subject: Travel
title: Timbuktu: City of Scholars
description: A short lesson to help you apply Timbuktu: City of Scholars.

hook.text: Timbuktu was the richest city in the medieval world. Its libraries held 700,000 manuscripts on math, medicine, and law.

buildup.text: Located in Mali, it was a center of trade, learning, and Islam. Gold and salt made it enormously wealthy.

discovery.text: Mansa Musa, its most famous ruler, gave away so much gold on a trip to Mecca that he crashed Egypt's economy.

twist.text: When Europeans finally reached it in the 1800s, the city had declined. They called it a 'disappointing mud town.'

climax.text: In 2012, militants threatened to burn the manuscripts. Locals smuggled 350,000 texts out in secret.

punchline.text: Locals risked their lives to save 350,000 ancient books.

quiz.question: What happened to Timbuktu's manuscripts in 2012?
options: Locals secretly smuggled them to safety
